meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the modern era.
meanings.sent1: The premodern artifacts in the museum fascinated the students.
meanings.sent2: The historian studied premodern civilizations to understand their way of life.
meanings.sent3: The premodern fashion trends seemed outdated but had a unique charm.
meanings.sent4: Her premodern beliefs clashed with the modern world's ideologies.
meanings.sent5: The premodern architecture stood as a testament to ancient craftsmanship.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or relating to the time before the modern era.
meanings.sent1: The premodern society valued traditions and rituals.
meanings.sent2: The premodern literature reflected the cultural norms of its time.
meanings.sent3: In the play, the premodern characters struggled with adapting to change.
meanings.sent4: His premodern mindset hindered his acceptance of new technologies.
meanings.sent5: The premodern artwork depicted scenes from a bygone era.
